activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer L Schmitt

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
DA Authorization to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jennifer L Schmitt appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn appeared by video for Jennifer L Schmitt. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
